thread.title: Leeds parts company with coach Uwe Rosler after latest loss
thread.title_full: Leeds parts company with coach Uwe Rosler after latest loss | Boston Herald

author: Associated Press
title: Leeds parts company with coach Uwe Rosler after latest loss
text:
LEEDS, England â€” Leeds is looking for a new manager after the struggling Championship club parted company with coach Uwe Rosler following a third consecutive defeat.
Leeds chairman Massimo Cellino said in a statement on Monday that Rosler, who was only appointed on a two-year contract in May, had shown "effort and commitment.
"Unfortunately, results didn't work out for him here and we are now looking elsewhere."
Saturday's 2-1 home defeat to Brighton has left Leeds in 18th place in the 24-team second tier of English football, just three points above the relegation zone.
The 46-year-old German had previously managed Wigan and Brentford before taking over at Leeds.
The club added that his assistant Rob Kelly and first-team coach Julian Darby "have both been placed on gardening leave."
A force in domestic and European football from the late 1960s to the mid-1970s, Leeds has struggled over the past decade and the team has yet to win at Elland Road this season.
